comment: Mrs. Mel is unprofessional and unorganized, to say the least. She shows up late for most labs and blames it on her babysitter, then proceeds to criticize the class for being lazy. She is not accessible outside of class at all and does not respond to emails most of the time. She does not give clear due dates or information at all. Do not take her!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: She is super sweet and loves to talk to all of her students. If you don't understand a concept, she will explain to you. Come to class with your notebook ready, there are content assessments and pre lab quizzes every other week but they aren't bad. She is not a tough grader and she is understanding. Take her!

Mel is my favorite professor ive had this semester. I took her for lab and if we did not understand what was going on shed explain it to us and help us understand. You have to show up to class prepared with a lab notebook done but it isnt hard. Theres content assessments and pre-lab quizzes outside of class. She truly cares about her students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: You have Content Assessments outside of class before the lab, but those are easy. She is honestly one of my favorite teachers and I suck at chem, so when it came to chem lab she was a angel. Really funny and makes sure you get the labs. I'm taking her again for chem 2 for sure! TAKE HER!!

professor Mel is great she really wants you to learn and she will help you if you dont understand something, she also likes to get to know her students and she likes to see that you're trying or asking for help at least

Her class is a bit confusing. If you are able to literally teach yourself i'd encourage you to take her. However, she is super sweet. Never exxpect to come to class unprepared, which is respected. Being that i'm not able to understand certain subjects on my own it makes it hard to ask questions during the labs. I wish the labs were better exlained.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: She is hands down the best lab professor because she forces you to learn the material, she wants you to learn, not just pass. Make sure to take good notes before and during each lab and read the procedure ahead of time. If she says, "Watch this video" do as she says. Don't just expect to show up unprepared and pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I enjoyed taking her until it was time to put in grades, she will talk to you the entire semester like you're the best of friends but then start harshly grading out of nowhere. She is so unorganized and unprofessional. Be on her good side or she'll randomly lash out and give a random pop quiz. Go to class and don't talk, get your grade and go.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: She's very caring and sweet, but if you expect to just show up unprepared (no notes, not reviewing the lab procedure ahead of time) she will call you out on it. She's harsh at times because laziness irritates her. That being said if you ever have any questions/trouble she is always there to help. MAKE SURE YOU WEAR PROPER LAB ATTIRE.
Great lab professor!! really helped me understand some of the topics I used for lecture! Really sweet teacher

Professor Mel is a very good professor. Don't expect to just show up and get a grade. You must prepare your notebook, do the labs, and take notes. Highly recommend taking notes before class. It will help for both the lab and any quizzes. She responds quickly to email and will meet during her office hours. One of the best professors I had here

Although her lab may seem hard at times, she truly does care and even disclosed that it is very hard to fail her class which is seemingly true. She can get very serious and down to business, but likes to joke around and also compliments people all the time. She does throw in some pop quizzes, some of which are very difficult, so read all prelabs!

expects perfection, she makes lots of mistakes and then messes everyone up and when she corrects herself will count off if you did it the way she said originally. she basically has no idea what the lab protocall is so good luck asking for help. also class started with 40 people over 75% of class dropped. yes i did the math lol
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: The lab was more difficult than it needed to be. Very quiet voice. POP QUIZZES. Will say you have a quiz the next week but then not post any material for you to study until day of/if that. Likes to make conversation. If you participate and answer her questions, you'll do fine. Lectures on class material despite being a lab prof. Nice lady, though.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader
